clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of a Triage Liaison Physician
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of a Triage Liaison Physician on the Time to First Medical Evaluation in the Emergency Departement

brief_summary.textblock: Due to an increasing number of patients admitted in emergency departments, many patients cannot be evaluated immediately after their admission. The function of "triage liaison physician" was introduced in Spring 2015. The objective of this study is to evaluate the impact of this new function on patients' flow in the ED.

detailed_description.textblock:
Geneva University Hospitals (GUH) emergency department (ED) admits more than 64000 patients every year. These patients are triaged using the Swiss Emergency Triage Scale (SETS), a 4-level triage scale. The SETS imposes time objectives until the first medical evaluation (20 minutes for SETS 2, 2 hours for SETS 3). In 2014, only 60% of level-2 and 63% of level-3 emergencies were evaluated within 20 and 120 minutes respectively.
A triage liaison physician was introduced in Spring 2015 with the mission to help triage nurse in their decisions and to evaluate quickly the patients that cannot be immediately installed in an ED evaluation room.
The objective of this study is to evaluate the impact of the triage liaison physician on the times to first medical evaluation.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients evaluated within SETS objectives
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients evaluated within time objective as defined by SETS standards.

secondary_outcome.description: Time elapsed between triage and first medical evaluation

arm_group.description: All patients admitted before the introduction of the function of triage liaison physician.
All patients admitted after the introduction of the function of triage liaison physician.

intervention.description: A triage liaison physician is present from 7:30 am to 10:30 pm, Monday to Friday, with the mission to evaluate quickly patients who cannot be immediately installed in an ED room

study_pop.textblock: All patient admitted in GUH ED during 2 years.
